payload.description: An open source flash player implementation

release.name: Development release
release.body: This is based on the latest commit.
release.short_description_html: This is based on the latest commit.

commits.message:
[Rendering/Filters] Fix issue with `DropShadow` in fragment shader

This would cause the glow/shadow to shrink, rather than grow.

[Rendering/Filters] Rename `clamp` to `_clamp` in `filter_convolution()`

This was causing GLES to fail to compile the shader.

[Rendering] Negate the shadow, and highlight x offsets in `filter_bevel()`

It's supposed to be subtracted from the current position.

[Shader/Filters] Save previous filter output, and use it as the destination

Before, we were only using `g_tex4` as the destination, which never
changes, since it always holds the original DisplayObject texture.

This was causing issues when multiple filters are chained together,
especially if the filter does a blur as one of it's steps.

This change solves that by saving the output of the previous filter, and
making that available for the next filter via `g_tex5`.

Note that for the first filter, we do use `g_tex4`, since `g_tex5` is
already bound to the filter output texture, but for subsequent filters,
we use `g_tex5` from then on.

issue.title: Is it still necessary for cmake to search for Gnash?
issue.body: Gnash is pretty much non-existent anymore. If there is no reason to include it in CMakeLists.txt, we should remove it.

comment.body: @huwdp I believe Ruffle has OpenGL support now, but ONLY on Linux

issue.title: Fancy Pants Classic Pack Demo - Unimplemented Function NativeWindowBoundsEvent
issue.body:
## In order to help us understand your issue, please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them **carefully** and answer honestly
- Put an `x` into all the boxes `[ ]` relevant to your issue (like this: `[x]`)
- Please fill in the sections relevant to your issue and delete the rest.
- Use the *Preview* tab to see what your issue will actually look like

---

### What is the purpose of your issue?
- [ ] Site Support Request: Lightspark does not work correctly on a specific website.
- [X] Bug: Lightspark has the same problem across multiple websites or SWF files.
- [ ] Feature request: a request for new features or support for new platforms, *not sites or SWF files*.
- [ ] Question, Comment, or Suggestion
- [ ] If none of the above apply, check this box.

---

### The following sections should be filled in based on the purpose listed above. Erase any section (the contents between triple ---) that does not apply.

---

### If this issue is a *bug report* or *site support request*:

#### Provide the complete URL of the page with the issue here:

URL of page

#### If it is possible to download the file and run it with the command line, please provide a link to the file here:

URL of file:
Demo is here:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/2168130
Direct Steam Install Link
steam://install/2168130

#### Provide the complete set of instructions required to reproduce the problem:

1. Load ClassicPack.swf from the Fancy Pants Adventures Classic Pack demo
#### What kind of failure is your issue?

- [X] **Fault**: You receive a black window instead of the flash content with a white text such as ``We're sorry, Lightspark encountered an as yet unsupported Flash file``
- [ ] **Crash**: The window disappears or your browser crashes with a message such as ``A tab has crashed``
- [ ] **Broken**: Lightspark shows something, but most of the file is not usable
- [ ] **Glitch**: Lightspark shows something and most of the file is usable, but things are missing or wrong compared to official Flash.
- [ ] **Performance**: Lightspark runs slow or uses lots of memory trying to play the file

#### Provide the Lightspark version

Output of ``lightspark -v``:

```
INFO: Lightspark version 0.8.7-git Copyright 2009-2013 Alessandro Pignotti and others
```

#### What operating system are you are running on?

- [X] Windows 7, 8, 10 or 11
- [ ] Windows XP, Vista or older
- [ ] Linux: *<specify distro and version here, such as Ubuntu 18.04>*
- [ ] Mac OS X: *<specify version here, such as 10.8.1>*
- [ ] Other: *<specify OS and version here>*

#### How are you are running Lightspark?

- [ ] Browser plugin for Chrome or Chromium: *<specify Chromium version here>*
- [ ] Browser plugin for Waterfox: *<specify Waterfox version here>*
- [ ] Browser plugin for other browser: *<specify browser and version here>*
- [X] Lightspark executable on the command line

#### Which of these actions you have taken to help debug the problem?

- [X] I attached a screen shot of the problem to this issue
- [X] I have a backtrace listing and pasted it in the bottom section of this issue (*hint: hitting Ctrl-C after a crash will copy it to the clipboard*)
```
SWF file: file://C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Fancy Pants Adventures Classic Pack Demo\ClassicPack.swf
ReferenceError: Error #1065: Error #1065: Variable NativeWindowBoundsEvent is not defined.
    at SuperLoaderMain/()
```
- [X] I have reproduced the problem using the Lightspark command line executable
- [X] I ran `lightspark -l 4` on the command line and am attaching logs to this issue (*hint: if they are too big, zip them*)
[log.txt](https://github.com/lightspark/lightspark/files/12861691/log.txt)

comment.body:
Technically the issue is fixed, but now another exception is thrown...
So I'm keeping this open until the application starts properly.

issue.title: Diggy: Freeze in BigDino intro
issue.body:
### What is the purpose of your issue?
- [ ] Site Support Request: Lightspark does not work correctly on a specific website.
- [x] Bug: Lightspark has the same problem across multiple websites or SWF files.
- [ ] Feature request: a request for new features or support for new platforms, *not sites or SWF files*.
- [ ] Question, Comment, or Suggestion
- [ ] If none of the above apply, check this box.

### If this issue is a *bug report* or *site support request*:

#### Provide the complete URL of the page with the issue here:

http://www.notdoppler.com/diggy.php

#### If it is possible to download the file and run it with the command line, please provide a link to the file here:

http://i.notdoppler.com/files/diggy.swf

#### Provide the complete set of instructions required to reproduce the problem:

1. Load the SWF file in Lightspark

#### What kind of failure is your issue?

- [ ] **Fault**: You receive a black window instead of the flash content with a white text such as ``We're sorry, Lightspark encountered an as yet unsupported Flash file``
- [ ] **Crash**: The window disappears or your browser crashes with a message such as ``A tab has crashed``
- [x] **Broken**: Lightspark shows something, but most of the file is not usable
- [ ] **Glitch**: Lightspark shows something and most of the file is usable, but things are missing or wrong compared to official Flash.
- [ ] **Performance**: Lightspark runs slow or uses lots of memory trying to play the file

#### Provide the Lightspark version

Output of ``lightspark -v``:

```
INFO: Lightspark version 0.8.7-git Copyright 2009-2013 Alessandro Pignotti and others
```
Note: I am using the latest development release (at the time of writing)

#### What operating system are you are running on?

- [x] Windows 10
- [ ] Windows XP, Vista or older
- [ ] Linux: *<specify distro and version here, such as Ubuntu 18.04>*
- [ ] Mac OS X: *<specify version here, such as 10.8.1>*
- [ ] Other: *<specify OS and version here>*

#### How are you are running Lightspark?

- [ ] Browser plugin for Chrome or Chromium: *<specify Chromium version here>*
- [ ] Browser plugin for Waterfox: *<specify Waterfox version here>*
- [ ] Browser plugin for other browser: *<specify browser and version here>*
- [x] Lightspark executable on the command line

#### Which of these actions you have taken to help debug the problem?

- [ ] I attached a screen shot of the problem to this issue
- [ ] I have a backtrace listing and pasted it in the bottom section of this issue (*hint: hitting Ctrl-C after a crash will copy it to the clipboard*)
- [x] I have reproduced the problem using the Lightspark command line executable
- [ ] I ran `lightspark -l 4` on the command line and am attaching logs to this issue (*hint: if they are too big, zip them*)

### Description of your issue

In Lightspark, Diggy nearly always freezes during the BigDino intro. This is an easily reproducible instance of a problem that seems to affect many games. Lightspark is currently mostly unusable for me because it freezes randomly (or predictably) in so many games.

comment.body: I've implemented rendering of filters in OpenGL which should make everything run smoother and faster, so this might help with your problem, too.
